actions.label: Snack
actions.description: A roc gains a +2 circumstance bonus to hit with its beak Strike if the target is grabbed or restrained in its talon.

actions.label: Snatch
actions.description: A roc can Fly at half Speed while it has a creature grabbed or restrained in either or both of its talons, carrying that creature along with it.

traits.label: Trigger
traits.description: A creature moves from beyond the reach of the roc’s wing to within the reach of the roc’s wing.

traits.label: Effect
traits.description: The roc makes a wing Strike against the creature. If the roc Pushes the creature, it disrupts the triggering move action.

actions.label: Extend Strands
actions.description: A roper extends six thin, sticky tendrils from its body, or retracts them back into its body. While they’re extended, the roper takes a –4 circumstance penalty to Stealth checks, and while they’re retracted, it can’t use its strand Strikes.

actions.label: Flurry of Strands
actions.description: The roper makes a strand Strike with each of its strands (except those that are entangling creatures). Each attack must be against a different target. These attacks count toward the roper’s multiple attack penalty, but its multiple attack penalty doesn’t increase until after all the attacks.

actions.label: Pull the Strands
actions.description: The roper pulls every creature entangled by its strands toward itself. The roper attempts a single Athletics check against each entangled creature’s Fortitude DC. On a success, the creature is pulled 25 feet closer to the roper; on a critical success, it’s pulled 50 feet closer; on a failure, it’s pulled 10 feet closer, and on a critical failure it’s not pulled at all.

actions.label: Sticky Strand
actions.description: Any creature hit by a roper’s strand is enfeebled 1 and entangled. A creature entangled by a roper can’t move beyond the reach of the roper’s strand. Each additional hit from a roper’s strand increases the amount of enfeeblement by 1 (to a maximum of enfeebled 4). The enfeebled value from the roper’s strands decreases by 1 every 8 hours. Entangling a creature occupies one of the roper’s strands. It can choose not to entangle a creature it hits, and can release an entangled creature as a free action triggered when the roper is about to act or ends its turn. A creature entangled in a roper’s strand can attempt to Escape as though freeing itself from a grab. A creature can sever a strand by hitting AC 25 (TAC 24), and dealing at least 18 points of slashing damage. This doesn’t deal any damage to the roper itself, though it can no longer attack with a severed strand.

traits.label: Trigger
traits.description: A creature within reach of the roper’s strand leaves a square during a move action it’s taking.

traits.label: Effect
traits.description: The roper makes a strand Strike at a –2 penalty against the triggering creature. This Strike doesn’t count toward its multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn’t apply to this Strike.

actions.label: Beckoning Call
actions.description: (auditory, concentrate, enchantment, mental, primal) Non-fey creatures within a 300-foot aura must succeed at a DC 27 Will save or become captivated by the rusalka’s song. A creature that fails is fascinated, and it must spend each of its actions to move closer to the rusalka as expediently as possible, while avoiding obvious dangers. If a beckoned creature is adjacent to the rusalka, it stays still and doesn’t act. The effect lasts for 1 round, but if the rusalka uses Beckoning Call again on subsequent rounds, she extends the duration by 1 round for any affected creature. If the rusalka attacks a beckoned creature, that creature is freed from the call at the end of the turn. A creature that critically failed its initial save isn’t automatically freed when attacked, but it can attempt a new save at the start of its turn if the rusalka attacked it that round. Once a creature succeeds at any of these saves, it’s bolstered.

actions.label: Constrict and Charm
actions.description: The rusalka deals 10 bludgeoning damage to any number of creatures grabbed or restrained in her hair. In addition, she can target one creature tangled in her hair with This expends one of her innate spells.

actions.label: Shameful Touch
actions.description: (emotion, enchantment, mental, primal) When the rusalka hits with her hand, the target is filled with overwhelming feelings of desire and shame. The target is sick 2 and must attempt a DC 28 Will save. If it fails, it’s slowed 2 for 1 round; if it succeeds, it’s slowed 1 for 1 round; if it critically succeeds, it isn’t slowed.

actions.label: Tangle Requirement
actions.description: The rusalka hit a creature with her hair on her most recent action this turn.

actions.label: Effect
actions.description: The rusalka automatically grabs the creature she hit. A creature grabbed in the rusalka’s hair can attempt to escape as normal. A rusalka can have up to eight creatures grabbed in her hair.

actions.label: Whipping Hair
actions.description: The rusalka makes two hair Strikes, each against a different creature.

traits.label: Charming Tresses
traits.description: (enchantment, mental, primal)

traits.label: Trigger
traits.description: A creature grabbed in the rusalka’s tresses of hair makes an attack against the rusalka.

traits.label: Effect
traits.description: The creature must succeed at a DC 28 Will save or its attack is disrupted.

actions.label: Antenna Disarm
actions.description: The rust monster can make an antenna Strike against a creature’s Reflex DC to attempt to disarm a metal item that creature is holding. If the attack is a critical hit, the rust monster drops the item on the ground in its own space (in addition to rusting the item).

actions.label: Rust
actions.description: A rust monster’s antenna causes metal to rapidly rust and corrode. If it hits a creature with an antenna attack, the rust monster can rust a metal item the creature is holding or wearing (including metal armor). If it hits an unattended metal item, it rusts the item. The rust dents the item (or deals two Dents on a critical hit). If a creature uses the Shield Block reaction against an antenna attack, the shield is automatically dented if it’s made of metal, but it protects the creature’s other items. The rust monster can dent an unattended item within reach with an antenna Strike.

traits.label: Metal Scent
traits.description: A rust monster has the scent ability, but it can smell only metals using it.

traits.label: Trigger
traits.description: A creature carrying a metal item moves out of a square the rust monster threatens.

traits.label: Effect
traits.description: The rust monster makes a tail Strike against the triggering creature.

actions.label: Blood Frenzy Requirement
actions.description: The sahuagin is not fatigued or already in a frenzy.

actions.label: Trigger
actions.description: The sahuagin deals bleed damage to a living creature.

actions.label: Effect
actions.description: The sahuagin flies into a frenzy that lasts 1 minute. While frenzied, the sahuagin gains a +1 conditional bonus to attack rolls with its claws and jaws, gains a +4 conditional bonus to damage rolls with its claws and jaws, gains 7 temporary HP until the end of the frenzy, and takes a –2 conditional penalty to AC.

actions.label: Bloodletting
actions.description: When the sahuagin deals piercing or slashing damage, it also deals 1d4 persistent bleed damage if the target was flat-footed or if the attack was a critical hit.

traits.label: Items
traits.description: heavy crossbow with 20 bolts, trident

traits.label: Shark Commune
traits.description: (mental, telepathy) The sahuagin can communicate telepathically with sharks in the listed range. It can communicate only simple concepts like “come,” “guard,” or “attack.”

actions.label: Blood Frenzy
actions.description: As sahuagin warrior, but 9 temporary HP

actions.label: Claw Whirl
actions.description: The sahuagin mutant makes a claw Strike against each creature within reach. The sahuagin’s multiple attack penalty doesn’t increase until after all these attacks.

actions.label: Bloodletting
actions.description: When the sahuagin deals piercing or slashing damage, it also deals 1d4 persistent bleed damage if the target was flat-footed or if the attack was a critical hit.

traits.label: Items
traits.description: heavy crossbow with 20 bolts, trident

traits.label: Shark Commune
traits.description: (mental, telepathy) As sahuagin warrior

actions.label: Armor of Flames
actions.description: The salamander stokes the flames from within its scales, empowering its defenses. It gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC for 1 round, and its Ignite improves.

traits.label: Items
traits.description: expert ranseur

traits.label: Ignite
traits.description: (fire)

traits.label: Trigger
traits.description: A creature adjacent to the salamander touches it or hits it with a physical attack.

traits.label: Effect
traits.description: The triggering creature takes 1d6 persistent fire damage (DC 19 Reflex save to negate) or 2d6 persistent fire damage (DC 21) if the salamander’s Armor of Flames is active.

actions.label: Effect
actions.description: The Sandpoint Devil breathes a 30-foot cone of fire. Creatures in the cone take 8d6 fire damage (Reflex DC 22 half, no damage on a critical success). If a creature critically fails its save, it is cursed by the flame for one month, appearing horribly burned and suffering a –2 conditional penalty on all attack rolls, saving throws, Perception checks, and skill checks. Healing never alters the appearance of the burns while the curse remains. This critical failure effect is a curse effect.

actions.label: Bay
actions.description: (auditory, emotion, enchantment, fear, mental, occult) The Sandpoint Devil screams. Other creatures within 300 feet must succeed at a DC 22 Will save or become frightened 3; on a critical failure, the creature is also fleeing for 1 round. On a successful save, a creature is frightened 1, and on a critical success, it’s unaffected. No matter the result of its save, the creature is bolstered.

traits.label: Opportune Hoof
traits.description: As Attack of Opportunity, but only with the Sandpoint Devil’s hooves.

actions.label: Damage
actions.description: 4d10+8 piercing plus 2d6 negative and energy drain

actions.label: Damage
actions.description: 4d6+8 slashing plus 2d6 negative and energy drain

actions.label: At Will Rituals Bonetaker
actions.description: (divine, necromancy) Whenever a creature dies within 60 feet of a saxra, the saxra draws a small fragment of the creature’s bones into its aura. The creature must succeed at a DC 36 Will save or rise as a skeletal champion (see page 106) in 1d4 rounds. Creatures raised as skeletal champions are overcome with the desire to slay living creatures, but the saxra has no special control over them.

actions.label: Energy Drain
actions.description: (divine, necromancy) When a saxra hits with a melee Strike, the target must succeed at a DC 35 Fortitude save or become enervated 2. On a critical failure, this condition cannot be removed normally, but only by magical treatment.

actions.label: Splintered Ground
actions.description: The saxra causes splintered bones to erupt from all solid surfaces in a 100-foot aura, except for surfaces of worked stone. Any creature moving through the bones takes 10 piercing damage and 10 negative damage for every 5 feet of movement. The first time each round a creature takes piercing damage from these splintered bones, it must succeed at a Reflex save or be hampered 10 for 10 minutes, or hampered 15 for 24 hours on a critical failure. Once hampered, the creature is bolstered until it recovers from the condition. The bones remain in place until the saxra uses this action again, or the bones are manually removed, which takes 10 minutes for each 5-foot square.

traits.label: Skeletal Lore
traits.description: (divination, divine) A saxra taps into the memories of the creatures whose bones make up its body. This gives it the Skeletal Lore skill, which it can use to Recall Knowledge of any kind, and lets it speak all the languages known by the creatures whose bones make up its body (typically including Common and the regional language of the saxra’s home region). The saxra can use Skeletal Lore as the primary skill check for the ritual, and it can cast without secondary casters. vs. positive poison;

traits.label: Resistances
traits.description: piercing 15, slashing 15

traits.label: Shard Storm
traits.description: (air, aura, divine, necromancy) 10 feet. A whirling cloud of bone shards surrounds a saxra. When a creature moves into the aura or begins its turn there, the aura attempts to dispel any effect on the creature (counteract level 8), and then deals the creature 5d6 slashing damage and 5d6 negative damage (Reflex DC 34 for half damage, no damage on a critical success, double damage on a critical failure).

traits.label: Rebuffing Gale
traits.description: (air, conjuration, divine)

traits.label: Trigger
traits.description: A creature approaches within 100 feet of the saxra.

traits.label: Effect
traits.description: The saxra hurls a blast of wind at the triggering creature with. The creature must succeed at a DC 36 Fortitude save or be pushed 20 feet in a direction of the saxra’s choice (30 feet on a critical failure). If the creature is pushed, its action ends.

traits.label: Trigger
traits.description: A creature moves from out of the scorpion’s reach into the scorpion’s reach.

traits.label: Effect
traits.description: The scorpion makes a stinger Strike against the triggering creature. The scorpion’s multiple attack penalty is not applied to this attack.

actions.label: Ranged
actions.description: water spout +22 touch (range increment 100 feet, water),

actions.label: Capsize
actions.description: (attack, move) The sea serpent attempts to capsize an aquatic vessel of its size or smaller that it’s adjacent to. It must succeed at an Athletics check with a DC of 28 or the pilot’s Sailing Lore DC, whichever is higher.

actions.label: Sea Serpent Algae
actions.description: (poison) The water in the ballast organs around the sea serpent’s neck is full of psychotropic algae.

actions.label: Stage 1
actions.description: confused and, if flying, descends 20 feet (1 round);

actions.label: Stage 2
actions.description: confused and, if flying, descends to the ground or water below (1 round).

actions.label: Spine Rake
actions.description: (move) The sea serpent extends the spines along its back and Swims or Strides. Each creature the serpent is adjacent to at any point during its movement takes 4d6+8 slashing damage (DC 28 Reflex save for half, or no damage on a critical success).

traits.label: Undetectable
traits.description: A sea serpent automatically tries to counteract any detection, revelation, or scrying divination attempted against it, using a Stealth check. This has a counteract level of 7.

traits.label: Items
traits.description: dagger, shortbow with 30 arrows magic, +4 conditional to saves vs. mental

traits.label: Items
traits.description: falchion magic, +4 conditional to saves vs. mental

actions.label: Effect
actions.description: The sewer ooze unleashes a wave of filth and slime, hitting all creatures within a 20-foot aura. Creatures in the area take 1d4 acid damage and are hampered 10 feet for 1 minute unless they succeed at a DC 15 Reflex save (no damage or hampered on a success, and a character additionally falls prone on a critical failure). An affected creature can clean off the muck as an Interact action, reducing the hampered condition by 5 feet with each action.

actions.label: Cast Shadow
actions.description: (arcane, concentrate, darkness, evocation) The shadow fills its square with magical darkness that moves with the shadow and persists for 1d4 rounds. The shadow can’t Cast a Shadow again until the magical darkness expires.

actions.label: Shadow Spawn
actions.description: When a creature’s shadow is pulled free by Steal Shadow, it becomes a shadow spawn under the command of the shadow that created it. This shadow spawn doesn’t have Steal Shadow, and is perpetually and incurably enervated 2. If the creature the shadow spawn was pulled from dies, the shadow spawn becomes a full, autonomous shadow. A creature separated from its shadow recovers from Steal Shadow’s enfeeblement half as quickly. If it recovers entirely, its shadow returns to it and the shadow spawn is extinguished.

actions.label: Slink in Shadows Requirement
actions.description: The shadow is hiding in darkness.

actions.label: Effect
actions.description: The shadow Sneaks up to its Speed and doesn’t need to stop hiding if it ends its movement in darkness.

actions.label: Requirement
actions.description: The shadow hit a living creature with a shadow hand Strike on its previous action.

actions.label: Effect
actions.description: The shadow pulls at the target’s shadow, making the creature enfeebled 1 (or enfeebled 2 if the previous action was a critical hit). This is cumulative with other enfeebled conditions from shadows. If this increases a creature’s enfeebled value to 3 or more, the shadow tears the target’s shadow free from its body (see shadow spawn). The enfeebled condition from Steal Shadow reduces by 1 every 8 hours, ending once it hits enfeebled 0. The recovery speed is halved if the shadow is separated from the creature’s body.

traits.label: Resistances
traits.description: all 5 (except force, ghost touch, or positive);

traits.label: Weaknesses
traits.description: light vulnerability

traits.label: Light Vulnerability
traits.description: An object shedding magical light (such as from the spell) is treated as magical for the purpose of bypassing the shadow’s immunity to nonmagical attacks.

actions.label: At Will Shadow Spawn
actions.description: As shadow, but the spawn isn’t enervated.

actions.label: Steal Shadow
actions.description: (divine, necromancy) As shadow, but causes enfeebled 2 (or enfeebled 3 on a critical hit).

actions.label: Requirement
actions.description: The greater shadow is hiding in darkness.

actions.label: Effect
actions.description: The greater shadow instantly teleports from one area of darkness to another within 30 feet and remains hidden.

traits.label: Resistances
traits.description: all 8 (except force, ghost touch, or positive);

traits.label: Weaknesses
traits.description: light vulnerability

traits.label: Light Vulnerability
traits.description: An object shedding magical light (such as from the spell) is treated as magical for the purposes of bypassing the shadow’s immunity to nonmagical attacks.

name: Shambler

actions.label: Vine Lash
actions.description: The shambler makes a vine Strike against each creature within its reach. Increase its multiple attack penalty only after all the attacks.

actions.label: Mound
actions.description: When it’s not in danger, the shambler spends 1 minute settling into a pile that looks like a lump of loose vegetation. In this form, creatures must actively search and succeed at a DC 24 Perception check (DC 27 in forests or swamps) to detect its true nature.

traits.label: Shamble Requirements
traits.description: The shambler is in mound form.

traits.label: Trigger
traits.description: A creature that’s unaware the mound is a creature comes within 10 feet.

traits.label: Effect
traits.description: The shambler makes a Strike against the creature. Combat begins after this attack.

traits.label: Electric Surge
traits.description: Whenever the shambler would take electricity damage or is targeted with an electricity effect, it gains 12 temporary HP and is quick for 1 round, able to Stride, Strike, or Swim with the extra action.

languages: Common or Elven, Sylvan; can’t speak
skills: +5; Athletics +13, Stealth +11 (+14 in forests or swamps)

actions.label: Trigger
actions.description: The shark is adjacent to a creature and moves away during a move action.

actions.label: Effect
actions.description: The shark makes a jaws Strike against the creature it’s moving away from. This Strike deals 1d6+1 damage instead of the normal amount.

traits.label: Shark Scent
traits.description: The shark can smell blood in the water from up to a mile away.

actions.label: Breach
actions.description: The shark Swims up to its speed, then Leaps vertically out of the water up to 10 feet high, making a Strike against a creature at the apex of the jump (this lets it attack a creature within 15 feet of the water’s surface). After the Strike, the shark splashes back down.

actions.label: Trigger
actions.description: The shark is adjacent to a creature and moves away during a move action.

actions.label: Effect
actions.description: The shark makes a jaws Strike against the creature it’s moving away from. This Strike deals 1d8+3 damage instead of the normal amount.

actions.label: Savage Requirement
actions.description: The shark hit with a jaws Strike on its most recent action this turn.

traits.label: Shark Scent
traits.description: The shark can smell blood in the water from up to a mile away.

actions.label: Breach
actions.description: The shark Swims up to its speed, then Leaps vertically out of the water up to 25 feet high, making a Strike against a creature at the apex of the jump (this lets it attack a creature within 30 feet of the water’s surface). After the Strike, the shark splashes back down.

actions.label: Savage Requirement
actions.description: The shark hit with a jaws Strike on its most recent action this turn.

traits.label: Shark Scent
traits.description: The shark can smell blood in the water from up to a mile away.

actions.label: Eat Away
actions.description: A creature that begins its turn inside the shoggoth takes 4d10 acid damage.

traits.label: Resistances
traits.description: acid 20, cold 20, electricity 20, fire 20, sonic 20

traits.label: Maddening Cacophony
traits.description: (auditory, aura, mental) 60 feet. A shoggoth constantly voices sounds and words that mortal life was not meant to hear. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a DC 34 Will save or become confused for 1 round (2d4 rounds on a critical failure). A creature that successfully saves is bolstered.

traits.label: All-Around Vision
traits.description: A shoggoth can’t be flanked.

actions.label: Sinful Bite
actions.description: (mental) A creature hit by the jaws Strike of a sinspawn must attempt a DC 15 Will save as it is assailed by sinful thoughts.

actions.label: Critical Failure
actions.description: Sick 2 and slowed 1 as long as it remains sick.

actions.label: Sin
actions.description: A sinspawn gains one or more skills and a special ability based on its sin. The skills and abilities of the most common sins are found below. •

actions.label: Envy
actions.description: Survival +7. A creature struck by the envyspawn’s jaws suffers the effects of a spell (DC 16), then is bolstered. •

actions.label: Gluttony
actions.description: Survival +7. Increase the damage of a gluttonyspawn’s bite to 1d10+4. On critical hit with a bite Strike, the gluttonyspawn regains 2d6 Hit Points. •

actions.label: Greed
actions.description: Thievery +7. The greedspawn has the Pickpocket skill feat and counts as having master proficiency rank for it. •

actions.label: Lust
actions.description: Diplomacy + 7. The lustspawn can cast as an arcane innate spell at will (DC 15). •

actions.label: Pride
actions.description: Performance +7, Society +7. The first time each round the pridespawn hits a creature, it gains 4 temporary Hit Points (8 on a critical hit). If it doesn’t hit at all during a round of combat, the pridespawn takes a –1 circumstance penalty to AC and saving throws for 1 round. •

actions.label: Sloth
actions.description: Deception +7. A creature struck by a slothspawn’s jaws suffers the effects of a spell (DC 16), then is bolstered. •

actions.label: Wrath
actions.description: Athletics +7, Intimidation +7. The wrathspawn can cast as an innate arcane spell (DC 15). A wrathspawn can’t cast the spell again for 1d4 rounds.

actions.label: Weapon Mastery
actions.description: Sinspawn are masters of armaments, and gain the critical specialization benefit for any weapons they wield. For example, if a sinspawn scores a critical hit with a ranseur, the target is moved 5 feet in a direction of the sinspawn’s choice.

traits.label: Items
traits.description: ranseur

traits.label: Sin Scent
traits.description: A sinspawn can smell creatures that reflect its sin, as the scent ability. The GM determines which creatures are appropriately sinful. magic, +4 conditional to saves vs. mental

traits.label: Items
traits.description: scimitar paralysis, poison;

traits.label: Resistances
traits.description: cold 5, electricity 5, fire 5, piercing 5, slashing 5

traits.label: Items
traits.description: chain mail, heavy steel shield (Hardness 5), longsword

traits.label: Will
traits.description: +4, +1 conditional to saves vs. positive disease, paralysis, poison;

traits.label: Resistances
traits.description: cold 5, electricity 5, fire 5, piercing 5, slashing 5

traits.label: Slink
traits.description: (move)

traits.label: Trigger
traits.description: A foe ends its movement adjacent to the viper or within the viper’s square.

traits.label: Effect
traits.description: The viper Strides, Climbs, or Swims up to 10 feet (or up to the relevant Speed, if that Speed is less than 10 feet). It must end its movement in a location that isn’t within 5 feet of a foe. This movement doesn’t trigger reactions.

actions.label: Wrap in Coils Requirement
actions.description: A Medium or smaller creature is grabbed or restrained in the ball python’s jaws.

actions.label: Effect
actions.description: The ball python moves the creature into its coils, freeing its mouth to make attacks, then uses Constrict against the creature. The ball python’s coils can hold one creature.

traits.label: Trigger
traits.description: A creature grabbed or restrained by the ball python attempts an Acrobatics check to Escape or an Athletics check to Break Grapple.

traits.label: Effect
traits.description: The DC for the triggering roll is increased by 2.

actions.label: Coil
actions.description: The giant viper takes an action to coil itself, increasing its reach with its fangs from 5 to 10 feet. After the giant viper Strikes with its fangs, it becomes uncoiled.

traits.label: Coiled Opportunity
traits.description: As Attack of Opportunity, but the snake can use this reaction only if it’s Coiled.

actions.label: Slither
actions.description: The giant anaconda Strides, Climbs, or Swims up to half its Speed, pulling any creatures it has grabbed with it.

actions.label: Wrap in Coils Requirement
actions.description: A Large or smaller creature is grabbed or restrained in the giant anaconda’s jaws.

actions.label: Effect
actions.description: The giant anaconda moves the creature into its coils, freeing its mouth to make attacks, then uses Greater Constrict against the creature. The giant anaconda’s coils can hold as many creatures as will fit in its space.

traits.label: Trigger
traits.description: A creature grabbed or restrained by the ball python attempts an Acrobatics check to Escape or an Athletics check to Break Grapple.

traits.label: Effect
traits.description: The DC for the triggering roll is increased by 2.

name: Hunting Spider

actions.label: Descend on a Web
actions.description: (move) The hunting spider Descends on a Web up to 40 feet straight down. It can hang from the web or drop off. The distance it Descends on the Web doesn’t count for calculating falling damage. If a creature succeeds at an attack against the web, it can sever it (AC 20, TAC 17, 5 hardness).

actions.label: Web Trap
actions.description: A creature hit by the hunting spider’s web attack is immobilized and stuck by the web to the nearest surface until it succeeds at an Acrobatics check to Escape (DC 15).

traits.label: Tremorsense
traits.description: The hunting spider’s tremorsense applies only against creatures touching its web.

traits.label: Spring Upon Prey Requirements
traits.description: Initiative has not yet been rolled.

traits.label: Trigger
traits.description: A creature touches the hunting spider’s web while the spider is lying in wait within the web.

traits.label: Effect
traits.description: The hunting spider automatically notices the creature and Strides, Climbs, or Descends on a Web before it rolls initiative.

speed: 25 feet, climb 25 feet; Descend on a Web 40 feet

traits.label: Tremorsense
traits.description: The spider swarm’s tremorsense only applies against creatures touching its web. bludgeoning 5, piercing 5, slashing 2;

traits.label: Weaknesses
traits.description: area damage 4, splash damage 4

traits.label: Swarming Bites
traits.description: Each enemy in the spider swarm’s space takes 1 piercing damage and is exposed to spider swarm venom. A DC 13 Reflex save negates the damage (double damage on a critical failure).

traits.label: Spider Swarm Venom
traits.description: (poison)

traits.label: Saving Throw
traits.description: Fortitude DC 13;

traits.label: Maximum Duration
traits.description: 4 rounds;

traits.label: Stage 1
traits.description: 1 poison and enfeebled 1 (1 round);

traits.label: Stage 2
traits.description: 2 poison and enfeebled 1 (1 round)

name: Goliath Spider

actions.label: Descend on a Web
actions.description: (move) The goliath spider Descends on a Web up to 120 feet straight down. It can hang from the web or drop off. The distance it Descends on the Web doesn’t count for calculating falling damage. If a creature succeeds at an attack against the web, it can sever it (AC 20, TAC 17, 20 hardness).

actions.label: Leg Strikes
actions.description: (attack) The spider makes two leg Strikes, each against a different creature. The two attacks use the same multiple attack penalty and count as one attack for calculating the spider’s multiple attack penalty.

actions.label: Requirements
actions.description: A creature is tethered to the goliath spider’s web tether.

actions.label: Effect
actions.description: If the goliath spider succeeds at an Athletics check against the creature’s Fortitude DC, it pulls that creature 20 feet closer to it (double distance on a critical success, half distance on a failure, no distance on a critical failure).

actions.label: Web Tether
actions.description: A creature hit by the spider’s web Strike is entangled and tethered to the spider, preventing it from moving farther away from the spider. The trapped creature or an adjacent creature can attempt a DC 28 Athletics check to Break Open the entangling web. Severing the tether requires attacking it and breaking it (AC 20, TAC 17, Hardness 20).

traits.label: Tremorsense
traits.description: The spider’s tremorsense applies against only creatures touching its web.

traits.label: Spring Upon Prey Requirements
traits.description: This reaction can be used only before initiative has been rolled.

traits.label: Trigger
traits.description: A creature touches the spider’s web while the spider is lying in wait within the web.

traits.label: Effect
traits.description: The goliath spider automatically notices the creature and can Stride, Climb, or Descends on a Web before rolling initiative.

speed: 45 feet, climb 30 feet, web descent 120 feet

name: Star-spawn Of Cthulhu

actions.label: Focused Assault
actions.description: (attack) The star-spawn of Cthulhu attacks a single target with all six of its face tentacles, overwhelming it with multiple attacks and leaving almost nowhere to dodge. On a successful attack, the star-spawn of Cthulhu deals damage from one tentacle to the target, plus an additional 1d6 damage for every tentacle beyond the first (normally 5d6 unless a tentacle is severed or occupied). Even on a failed attack, the star-spawn deals the damage from one tentacle to the target. It can’t Grab a creature on a failed attack and still misses completely on a critical failure. This counts toward the star- spawn’s multiple attack penalty as a number of attacks equal to the number of tentacles it uses.

actions.label: Tangle of Tentacles
actions.description: The star-spawn of Cthulhu makes up to six tentacle Strikes at a –2 penalty, each against a different target in a 15-foot cone. If it follows this by using a Grab action, it can Grab any number of creatures it hit instead of just one. These attacks count toward the star-spawn’s multiple attack penalty, and the multiple attack penalty doesn’t increase until after it makes all its attacks.

actions.label: Starflight
actions.description: A star-spawn of Cthulhu can use its fly Speed to fly in outer space despite the lack of atmosphere.

traits.label: Immortality
traits.description: The star-spawn of Cthulhu doesn’t age, nor does it need to eat or breathe. It can die only as a result of violence.

traits.label: Overwhelming Mind
traits.description: (mental)

traits.label: Trigger

traits.label: Effect

On a success, the creature is slowed 1 for 1 round; on a critical success, the creature is unaffected; on a critical failure, the creature is stunned for 1d4 rounds and permanently confused, as per the effects of a critical failure when casting Regardless of the save result, the creature becomes bolstered.

actions.label: Rituals Change Shape
actions.description: (concentrate, divine, polymorph) A thanatotic titan can take the shape of any humanoid of any size. In humanoid shape, it can Trample only creatures of its new size or smaller and its reach decreases to match its new size. If a titan is Huge, the reach of its halberd decreases to 40 feet, while the reach of its foot decreases to 20 feet (20 feet [halberd] and 10 feet [foot] if Large; and as normal for both Strikes if the titan is smaller).

actions.label: Trigger
actions.description: The thanatotic titan damages a creature that can cast divine spells or use divine abilities.

actions.label: Effect
actions.description: The damaged creature must succeed at a DC 44 Will save or become unable to use any of its divine spells and abilities for 1 day and become frightened 2 for as long as this restriction lasts. A success reduces the duration to 1 round, a critical success negates the effect, and a critical failure causes the damaged creature to lose its divine spells and abilities forever.

actions.label: Primordial Rock
actions.description: (divine) A thanatotic titan can shape creatures and objects alike from the primordial nature of the universe. When it creates a rock to throw, the titan imbues it with that nature, choosing any damage type for it to deal. After a rock Strike, the rock explodes in the square of its target, even on a miss (though not on a critical failure). This deals 10d6 damage of the chosen type to all creatures in a 20-foot burst (Reflex DC 44 half, no damage on a critical success, double damage on a critical failure).

actions.label: Vicious Arc
actions.description: The titan swings its halberd in a wide arc, making a Strike at a –2 penalty against every creature in a cone with a length equal to the reach of its titanic halberd (a 60-foot cone when the titan is Gargantuan). These Strikes deal slashing damage, and—even on a failure—deal minimum damage (typically 25, no damage on a critical failure). These attacks count as one attack toward the titan’s multiple attack penalty, and the penalty increases only after all the attacks have been made.

actions.label: Rituals Cannibal Feast
actions.description: (healing, necromancy, primal) If the wendigo deals bite damage to a creature it’s grabbing or restraining, it devours the victim’s flesh. The wendigo gains temporary HP equal to half the damage dealt and gains a +1 conditional bonus to all d20 rolls for 1 round. The victim takes 2d10 persistent bleed damage.

actions.label: Dream Haunting
actions.description: When the wendigo casts a target that fails at its save is exposed to wendigo torment.

actions.label: Howl
actions.description: (auditory, concentrate, enchantment, fear, mental, primal) The wendigo unleashes a forlorn howl that can be heard up to 1 mile away. Any creature that hears the howl must succeed at a DC 35 Will save or be frightened 1. Any creature that critically fails and is within 120 feet of the wendigo is instead frightened 3, and also flees for 1d4 rounds (or until it’s no longer frightened, whichever comes first). A creature frightened by a wendigo’s howl still naturally recovers from its fright but can’t reduce it below frightened 1 in this way until 1 hour has passed or magic is used. Whether it succeeds or fails, a creature is bolstered.

actions.label: Ride the Wind
actions.description: (concentrate, primal, transmutation) The wendigo turns into vapor (as and flies through the air. While in this form, it can spend an action to ride the wind rapidly, moving 200 feet in a straight line (this action has the move trait). The wendigo can spend an action to return to its normal form (this action has the concentrate trait). If the effect ends while the wendigo is airborne, the wendigo benefits from If the wendigo has a creature grabbed or restrained when it Rides the Wind, it can attempt to turn the grabbed creature into wind and carry it along as part of the action. The creature can attempt a DC 35 Will save to prevent being transformed. If the creature succeeds, the wendigo still transforms, automatically releasing the victim. A creature forced to Ride the Wind along with the wendigo is exposed to wendigo torment. The creature can attempt a new Will save each round to return to normal, though it immediately turns corporeal and begins falling if it succeeds.

actions.label: Wendigo Torment
actions.description: (curse, mental, necromancy, primal) A creature affected by wendigo torment can’t recover beyond stage 1 until brought to full HP.

actions.label: Stage 3
actions.description: The creature searches for an individual of its own race to kill and devour. If the creature succeeds, it then runs off at full speed, and after 1d4 rounds sprints into the sky so fast that its feet burn away into jagged stumps. As the creature rides the wind into the sky, it turns into a new wendigo over 2d6 minutes. The victim is replaced by a new wendigo, and only or a 9th-level spell can return it to life. The new wendigo remains even if the victim is resurrected.

During the rampage, the creature is under the GM’s control. Once the rampage ends, she falls unconscious until dawn, at which time she reverts to normal.

Until the full moon sets, the wererat can’t leave hybrid form, is affected by an spell, and has the damage of its jaws increased by 1d4. At daybreak, the wererat returns to human or giant rat form and is fatigued for 2d4 hours.
